info.title: Numverify API
info.description:
Numverify offers a full-featured yet simple RESTful JSON API for national and international phone number validation and information lookup for a total of 232 countries around the world.
                         
Requested numbers are processed in real-time, cross-checked with the latest international numbering plan databases and returned in handy JSON format enriched with useful carrier, geographical location and line type data.
                   
Integrating the Numverify API into your application will enable you to verify the validity of phone numbers at the point of entry, protecting you from fraud and increasing good leads.

get.description: Making a phone number validation request to the Numverify API is simple. Simply append the `number` parameter followed by the phone number you would like to validate to the API's Number Validation endpoint.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Your personal API access key required to authenticate requests.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Phone number to validate (can be in international or national format).

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Two-letter country code. Required if you provide the number in national format.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Set to `1` to prettify the JSON response (mainly for debugging purposes).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Provide a JSONP callback function name to wrap the response.

200.description: Validation result for the requested phone number.

schema.description: Response object containing details about a validated phone number.

valid.description: Indicates whether the provided phone number is valid.

number.description: Original phone number submitted for validation.

local_format.description:
Local/national representation of the phone number.
**Important:** *When using national phone numbers, you must specify a country code. Do not include a country_code parameter when using international numbers (e.g. 14158586273).*

country_prefix.description: Country calling code/prefix associated with the number.

location.description:
Location or city information (if available).
**Note:** *The location object may not be available for some phone numbers.*

carrier.description:
Carrier name of the phone number (if available).
**Note:** *Carrier information may not be available for certain phone numbers.*

line_type.description:
Type of phone line (e.g., mobile, landline, VoIP).
**Note:** *Knowing the line type of a given phone number makes it easy to decide optimally whether to send voice or text communications and ensures full compliance with the [FCC Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA)](https://www.fcc.gov/page-not-found).*

validNumberExample.summary: Example response for a valid phone number

invalidNumberExample.summary: Example response for an invalid phone number

403.description: Authentication error (missing or invalid access key).

get.description: The Numverify API supports phone number validation for a total of **232 countries** (territories) around the world. Using the API's `countries` endpoint, you may access a comprehensive list of supported areas, including country names and dialling codes.
